note.p: Birth: St Erth parish, Cornwall, England (06 March 1767)
Burial: The chapel of the Gilridges and Gilberts, north of the chancel of Eastbourne church, Sussex
Education: Penzance; Pembroke College, Oxford. MA (1789); DCL (1832)
Career: MP for Helston (1804) and then for Bodmin (1806-1832); encouraged Sir Humphry Davy and other pioneer engineers
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Family Tree Magazine (June 2003), "The Nancledra Mug" by Peter W Curtis
Obituaries: Abstract of Papers in the Philosophical Transactions (Royal Soc Proceedings) 1840 No 4 pp 256-258
References: W H Brock, 'The Selection of the Authors of the Bridgewater Treatises' in NR 1966 vol 21 pp 162-179, plate
Stephen G Brush, 'The Royal Society's First Rejection of the Kinetic Theory of Gases (1821), John Herapath versus Humphry Davy' in NR 1963 vol 18 pp 161-180
R K Bluhm, 'A Note on the Origin of the Society's Conversaziones' in NR 1958 vol 13 pp 61-63
L Pearce Williams, 'The Royal Society and the Founding of the British Association for the Advancement of Science' in NR 1961 vol 16 pp 221-233
